svcsubproc.title: Front Warning Lights

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secure scaffold assembly and safety restraints or equivalent equipment when servicing the bus roof or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

svcsubproc.para: The front warning lights mounted on the upper front cap section are replaceable; the lens can be removed to replace burned out bulbs.

step1.para: Utilizing a step ladder or stand, locate the light to be replaced, or bulb (incandescent bulbs) to be changed. With LED lights, the entire light must be replaced.
Locate the lens mounting screws on the light, loosen and remove.
Remove the lens cover and gasket if applicable.
Remove bulb if replacement is necessary.
To remove light assembly, locate the mounting screws securing light fixture to bus body. Loosen and remove mounting screws.
Disconnect light connection plug and remove light.
Check wire grommet in surface of body prior to installing new light.
Follow same procedure for other lights that may have to be changed or replaced.
